title: Directs the Energy Research and Development Authority to do a study as to a comprehensive energy plan for the downstate region of the state
summary: Directs the Energy Research and Development Authority to do a study as to a comprehensive energy plan for the downstate region of the state.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1679

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 11, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  JEFFRIES, MILLMAN, MAISEL, JAFFEE, TITONE --
         Multi-Sponsored by -- M.  of A. BENEDETTO, GABRYSZAK, HOOPER, McENENY,
         ROBINSON, SPANO -- read once and referred to the Committee on Energy

       AN ACT to amend the public authorities law, in relation to directing the
         New York state energy research and development authority to conduct  a
         study  related to a comprehensive energy plan for the downstate region
         of the state

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The  public  authorities  law  is amended by adding a new
    2  section 1855-a to read as follows:
    3    S 1855-A. COMPREHENSIVE ENERGY MANAGEMENT PLAN.  1. THE  AUTHORITY  IS
    4  HEREBY  AUTHORIZED  AND  DIRECTED  TO  CONDUCT  A COMPREHENSIVE STUDY TO
    5  ANALYZE THE ELECTRICITY AND STEAM CAPACITY AND POWER  DISTRIBUTION  GRID
    6  CONDITIONS  IN  THE DOWNSTATE REGION OF THE STATE.  FOR PURPOSES OF THIS
    7  SECTION, "DOWNSTATE" SHALL BE DEFINED AS THAT REGION  LOCATED  SOUTH  OF
    8  THE  MILLWOOD - SOUTH TRANSMISSION INTERFACE.  SUCH STUDY SHALL INCLUDE,
    9  BUT SHALL NOT BE LIMITED TO:
   10    (A) AN ANALYSIS OF PROJECTED POWER NEEDS AND AN ASSESSMENT  OF  EXIST-
   11  ING:
   12    (I) GENERATING FACILITIES WITH A CAPACITY OF TWENTY MEGAWATTS OR MORE;
   13    (II) POWER GRID CAPACITY AND LOAD POCKETS;
   14    (III) NATURAL GAS AND OTHER FUEL SOURCE CAPACITY;
   15    (IV) SUBSTATION TRANSFORMERS; AND
   16    (V) EMERGENCY GENERATORS;
   17    (B) AN ANALYSIS OF FUTURE POWER NEEDS;
   18    (C) AN ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENT OF GENERATING FACILITIES WITH A CAPAC-
   19  ITY OF TWENTY MEGAWATTS OR MORE INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO:
   20    (I) EMISSIONS;
   21    (II) WATER IMPACTS;
   22    (III) LAND USE IMPACTS;

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD02149-01-1

       A. 1679                             2

    1    (IV) TRAFFIC IMPACTS; AND
    2    (V) NOISE IMPACTS;
    3    (D) THE IDENTIFICATION OF AREAS OF OVERSATURATION OF POWER FACILITIES;
    4  AND
    5    (E) AN ASSESSMENT OF ALTERNATIVES, SUCH AS:
    6    (I) ENERGY EFFICIENCY;
    7    (II) LOAD CURTAILMENT;
    8    (III) CLEAN DISTRIBUTED GENERATION; AND
    9    (IV) CO-GENERATION.
   10    2.  THE  AUTHORITY  SHALL SUBMIT A COPY OF SUCH STUDY TO THE GOVERNOR,
   11  THE TEMPORARY PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE, THE SPEAKER OF THE ASSEMBLY,  THE
   12  CHAIRPERSON  OF  THE  SENATE ENERGY AND TELECOMMUNICATIONS COMMITTEE AND
   13  THE CHAIRPERSON OF THE ASSEMBLY ENERGY COMMITTEE NO LATER  THAN  JANUARY
   14  FIRST, TWO THOUSAND TWELVE.
   15    3.  UPON COMPLETION OF THE STUDY CONDUCTED PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION ONE
   16  OF THIS SECTION, THE AUTHORITY SHALL DEVELOP  AN  OVERALL  COMPREHENSIVE
   17  ENERGY  MANAGEMENT PLAN.   SUCH PLAN SHALL TAKE INTO ACCOUNT THE RESULTS
   18  AND FINDINGS OF SUCH STUDY, AND SHALL INCLUDE, BUT SHALL NOT BE  LIMITED
   19  TO THE FOLLOWING:
   20    (A) AN OUTLINE OF GUIDELINES AND REQUIREMENTS FOR SITING POWER PLANTS;
   21    (B)  THE  RESEARCH OF POTENTIAL SITES FOR FUTURE POWER PLANT LOCATIONS
   22  THAT MEET THE GUIDELINES AND REQUIREMENTS ESTABLISHED PURSUANT TO  PARA-
   23  GRAPH  (A) OF THIS SUBDIVISION AND ARE NOT LOCATED IN AREAS OF OVERSATU-
   24  RATION;
   25    (C) AN IDENTIFICATION OF EXISTING PLANTS THAT SHOULD BE  TARGETED  FOR
   26  RE-POWERING WITH MORE EFFICIENT GENERATORS; AND
   27    (D) A REQUIREMENT THAT AT LEAST TWO PUBLIC HEARINGS BE HELD WITHIN THE
   28  DOWNSTATE  REGION  DESCRIBED  IN  SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION WITHIN
   29  SIXTY DAYS OF THE PUBLICATION  OF  SUCH  MANAGEMENT  PLAN,  AND  PROVIDE
   30  ADEQUATE OPPORTUNITY FOR WRITTEN TESTIMONY REGARDING SUCH PLAN.
   31    4.  THE  AUTHORITY  SHALL SUBMIT A COPY OF SUCH MANAGEMENT PLAN TO THE
   32  GOVERNOR, THE TEMPORARY PRESIDENT OF THE  SENATE,  THE  SPEAKER  OF  THE
   33  ASSEMBLY,  THE  CHAIRPERSON  OF THE SENATE ENERGY AND TELECOMMUNICATIONS
   34  COMMITTEE AND THE CHAIRPERSON OF THE ASSEMBLY ENERGY COMMITTEE NO  LATER
   35  THAN SEPTEMBER FIRST, TWO THOUSAND TWELVE.
   36    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the public authorities law, in relation to directing the New York state energy research and development authority to conduct a study related to a comprehensive energy plan for the downstate region of the state
